intro: Donia canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
